excerpt: Museum featuring 100+ galleries with American & global art on display, from ancient to modern eras.
detail_description: The Detroit Institute of Arts (DIA) is a renowned museum located in Midtown Detroit, Michigan. Since its establishment in 1885, it has become a cultural hallmark of the city. The DIA boasts an extensive collection of art from around the world, spanning ancient Egyptian and European works to contemporary pieces.
name: Detroit Institute of Arts

excerpt: Collection of the label's art & memorabilia plus the famous studio A & The Supremes' costumes.
detail_description: The Motown Museum, located in Detroit, is a renowned landmark and a must-visit for music enthusiasts. It was the birthplace of Motown and played a pivotal role in launching the careers of legendary artists such as Stevie Wonder, Diana Ross & the Supremes, Smokey Robinson, and many more. The museum preserves the '60s charm of Hitsville USA and features Studio A where iconic music that transformed American culture was created.
name: Motown Museum
address: 2648 Berry Gordy Jr. Boulevard, 2648 W Grand Blvd, Detroit, MI 48208, USA

excerpt: Sprawling space dedicated to American life & ideas, includes the Rosa Parks bus & JFK's limo.
detail_description: The Henry Ford Museum of American Innovation in Dearborn, Michigan is a sprawling 250-acre space that offers a comprehensive look at American life and innovation. The museum features an impressive collection of exhibits showcasing the ingenuity and impact of American inventors and visionaries. Visitors can explore iconic artifacts such as the Rosa Parks bus, JFK's limousine, and the world's most accurate replica of the Wright brothers' Flyer.
name: Henry Ford Museum of American Innovation

excerpt: The Eastern Market area is named for the 19th-century market operating here, with vendors selling everything from tacos to colorful produce every Saturday. Sundays see the space packed with local jewelers and artists. Hip cafes and places serving classic Coney Island hot dogs dot the district whose warehouses are being revitalized with murals. There is live jazz and Motown music at relaxed Bert’s Warehouse Theatre.
detail_description: Eastern Market, located in Detroit, is a vibrant area known for its historic market where vendors offer a wide variety of goods every Saturday. On Sundays, the space transforms into a hub for local jewelers and artists. The district features trendy cafes, eateries serving classic Coney Island hot dogs, and warehouses adorned with colorful murals. Bert’s Warehouse Theatre hosts live jazz and Motown music for visitors to enjoy. As one of the largest open-air public marketplaces in the U.S.
name: Eastern Market

excerpt: Detroit River island & park featuring an aquarium, a conservatory, playgrounds, picnic areas & more.
detail_description: Belle Isle is a picturesque island and park located in the Detroit River, offering a wide range of attractions and activities. Designed by the architect of New York's Central Park, it boasts an impressive landscape with various amenities. The island features the Anna Scripps Whitcomb Conservatory, designed by Albert Kahn, which houses five distinct greenhouse sections providing a tropical escape from Michigan's harsh winters.
name: Belle Isle

excerpt: Baseball stadium features tiger statues on top, a 50-ft. Ferris wheel & a diverse food court.
detail_description: Comerica Park, the vibrant home of the Detroit Tigers since 2000, is a must-visit destination for baseball fans and food lovers alike. Nestled in Downtown Detroit, right across from the iconic Fox Theatre, this stadium boasts unique features like impressive tiger statues and a charming 50-foot Ferris wheel. The diverse food court offers an array of delicious options—from classic Detroit-style pizza to mouthwatering hamburgers and international flavors that cater to every palate.
name: Comerica Park

excerpt: Historic art deco skyscraper built in 1928 with a colorful tiled lobby & retail space.
detail_description: The Guardian Building, a historic art deco skyscraper completed in 1929, is a beloved landmark in Detroit. Designed by Wirt C. Rowland, the building's exterior features vibrant orange brickwork with tile, limestone, and terra cotta, while the interior boasts a colorful mosaic of Pewabic and Rookwood tile with Native American themes. Stone carvings by Corrado Parducci adorn the entrance.
name: Guardian Building

excerpt: Restored 1904 factory for the Ford Model T featuring historical tours & many original cars.
detail_description: The Ford Piquette Avenue Plant Museum is a remarkable destination that celebrates the birthplace of the iconic Model T. This restored factory from 1904 serves as both a museum and an educational center, offering engaging historical tours and showcasing numerous original vehicles. As a nonprofit organization dedicated to preserving this significant site, it hosts various programs and events throughout the year, catering to diverse audiences including families and groups on bus tours.
name: Ford Piquette Avenue Plant Museum

excerpt: Exhibits explore African-American history from the Middle Passage to the Underground Railroad.
detail_description: The Charles H. Wright Museum of African American History is a must-visit for history enthusiasts, as it is the largest museum dedicated to preserving and showcasing African American history and culture. Founded by Dr. Charles H. Wright in 1965, the museum houses over 35,000 artifacts from across the Diaspora, offering a comprehensive look at the multicultural stories of people from around the world.
name: Charles H. Wright Museum of African American History
address: 315 E Warren Ave, Detroit, MI 48201, USA

excerpt: Grand theater with gilded, Asian-inspired decor hosts theater productions, musicians & comedians.
detail_description: The Fox Theatre, a grand theater adorned with opulent Asian-inspired decorations, has been a hub for various entertainment events since its construction in 1928 by film pioneer William Fox. This historic venue, listed on the National Register of Historic Places, boasts a seating capacity of 5,048 and has hosted numerous iconic performances over the years.
name: Fox Theatre

excerpt: Science & technology museum for kids offers interactive exhibits, a planetarium, shows & a cafe.
detail_description: Michigan Science Center is a family-friendly museum in Detroit that offers interactive exhibits, a planetarium, live science demonstrations, and insightful programming for all ages. The center features over 220 interactive displays focusing on science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) fields to ignite creativity and curiosity. Visitors can also enjoy the Toyota 4D Theater with daily screenings of fascinating movies.
name: Michigan Science Center
address: 5020 John R St, Detroit, MI 48202, USA

excerpt: Museum features interactive & revolving exhibits on the city's history, including recreated streets.
detail_description: The Detroit Historical Museum, located in the city's Cultural Center, offers an immersive journey through over 300 years of Detroit's history. Visitors can explore how the city evolved and was shaped by cultural and social changes. One of its most popular exhibits is the Streets of Old Detroit, where guests can walk through a life-sized recreation of a 20th-century Detroit street.
name: Detroit Historical Museum

excerpt: City square with concert space & seasonal ice-skating, plus a bistro amid fountains & trees.
detail_description: Nestled in downtown Detroit, Campus Martius Park is an 8-acre public square that has been a focal point of the city since its establishment in 2004. This vibrant space hosts a variety of events throughout the year, from winter ice skating to summer concerts and festivals. Visitors can enjoy the park's fountains, trees, and two performance stages. Additionally, there are dining options like Parc Detroit and the Cruzan Rum Shack for a beach-like atmosphere during warm weather.
name: Campus Martius Park

excerpt: Detroit is the largest city in the midwestern state of Michigan. Near Downtown, the neoclassical Detroit Institute of Arts is famed for the Detroit Industry Murals painted by Diego Rivera, and inspired by the city’s ties to the auto industry, giving it the nickname "Motor City." Detroit is also the birthplace of Motown Records, whose chart-topping history is on display at their original headquarters, Hitsville U.S.A.
detail_description: Detroit, the largest city in Michigan, is known for its ties to the auto industry, earning it the nickname 'Motor City.' The Detroit Institute of Arts showcases the famous Detroit Industry Murals by Diego Rivera. Additionally, as the birthplace of Motown Records, Hitsville U.S.A. offers a glimpse into its chart-topping history. In terms of dining experiences, Coffee and (_) in Detroit serves up fresh menu items that change daily and are made with locally sourced ingredients.
name: Detroit

detail_description: The Detroit Riverwalk, stretching over three miles along the Detroit River from Rosa Parks Blvd. to the Belle Isle Bridge, is a stunning urban escape offering picturesque views of both Detroit and Canada. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk, run, or bike ride while taking in new developments and lush greenery. The park features amenities such as the RiverWalk Cafe, splash parks for kids, playgrounds, picnic areas, and restrooms.
name: Detroit Riverwalk

excerpt: The busy Downtown district centers on Woodward Avenue, lined with indie and chain stores. Campus Martius Park brims with food trucks, plus a man-made beach in summer and an ice rink in winter. Comerica Park is home to the Detroit Tigers baseball team, while the ornate Fox Theatre puts on concerts and musicals. Cocktail lounges, dive bars, high-end steakhouses, and low-key lunch spots are scattered throughout.
detail_description: Downtown Detroit is a bustling district centered around Woodward Avenue, featuring a mix of independent and chain stores. Campus Martius Park offers a vibrant atmosphere with food trucks, a man-made beach in the summer, and an ice rink in the winter. The area is also home to Comerica Park, where the Detroit Tigers play, and the ornate Fox Theatre hosts concerts and musicals.
name: Downtown Detroit

excerpt: Waterside district home to the RiverWalk, plus lively parks & plazas hosting concerts & festivals.
detail_description: Detroit Riverfront is a vibrant waterside district that has undergone significant revitalization efforts, resulting in 3.5 miles of scenic waterfront trails, parks, and infrastructure. The Detroit Riverfront Conservancy has played a key role in beautifying the area and creating spaces for outdoor events and activities. With its wide pathways for walking, cycling, and other recreational uses, it offers opportunities for residents and visitors to enjoy the outdoors.
name: Detroit Riverfront
address: 588 E Jefferson Ave, Detroit, MI 48207, USA

excerpt: Art deco skyscraper from 1928, featuring marble from all over the world & a live theater venue.
detail_description: The Fisher Building, an iconic Art Deco skyscraper completed in 1928, is a must-see for architecture enthusiasts visiting Detroit. Designed by renowned architect Albert Kahn, this 441-foot tower is adorned with exquisite marbles from around the world and features a live theater venue. The building's interiors boast soaring painted ceilings, intricate mosaics, and lavish brass and bronze details.
name: Fisher Building
address: 3011 W Grand Blvd, Detroit, MI 48202, USA

excerpt: Ex-auto dealership turned cavernous gallery of ever-changing contemporary art exhibits & lectures.
detail_description: The Museum of Contemporary Art Detroit, also known as MOCAD, is a cultural gem housed in a former auto dealership. It showcases an ever-changing array of contemporary art exhibits and hosts lectures. The museum features both permanent and rotating exhibitions from leading artists across various mediums such as painting, sculpture, video, and unique installations.
name: Museum of Contemporary Art Detroit

detail_description: Eastern Market, located northeast of Downtown, is a food lover's paradise with its renowned farmers market on Saturdays and arts and crafts market on Sundays. The neighborhood offers a diverse culinary experience, from local specialty hot dogs to Polish street food and amazing sandwiches. Visitors can also explore spacious loft rentals available in the area. As one of the oldest and largest year-round markets, Eastern Market hosts an eclectic mix of local food, art, and music every Saturday.
name: Eastern Market

excerpt: Largely below street level, this 2-mile greenway offers urban art plus pedestrian & biking lanes.
detail_description: The Dequindre Cut is a 2-mile urban greenway in Detroit that was once a Grand Trunk Railroad line and now offers pedestrian and biking lanes. It features vibrant murals, providing a unique urban hiking experience. The trail connects to the Riverwalk, where visitors can enjoy luscious green parks, plazas, and iconic city architecture along the Detroit River. Additionally, it provides easy access to the renowned gardens on Belle Isle.
name: Dequindre Cut
address: Dequindre Cut Greenway, Detroit, MI 48207, USA

excerpt: Outdoor, nonprofit art space showcasing funky installations made from recycled materials.
detail_description: The Heidelberg Project is a unique outdoor art space in Detroit, founded in 1986 by artist Tyree Guyton. It aims to revitalize the city's East Side through open-air installations made from recycled materials. The project has transformed the neighborhood into an art gallery with painted houses and colorful exhibitions, promoting artistic and cultural relevance in Detroit. This ongoing initiative encourages the reuse and revitalization of found objects, contributing to educational and healing experiences for visitors.
name: The Heidelberg Project

excerpt: Greektown is a commercial and entertainment district in Detroit, Michigan, located just northeast of the heart of downtown, along Monroe Avenue between Brush and St. Antoine streets. It has a station by that name on the city's elevated downtown transit system known as the Detroit People Mover. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Greektown, situated in Detroit, Michigan, is a bustling commercial and entertainment hub located just northeast of downtown. It boasts a rich history as the settlement area for Greek immigrants in the early 20th century. Despite the community's relocation in later years, Greektown has preserved its distinctive character with numerous Greek restaurants and coffeehouses that continue to draw visitors.
name: Greektown

excerpt: Iconic, luxurious 1920s-era space boasts 1,037 rooms & hosts live entertainment plus film shoots.
detail_description: The Masonic Temple, located in the former Cass Corridor, is a grand 1920s-era building that stands as the largest of its kind globally. This neo-Gothic structure was completed in 1926 by George D. Mason and remains home to various Masonic organizations in Detroit. Boasting 1,037 rooms, it features three theaters, ballrooms, a swimming pool, bowling alley, and more within its labyrinthine layout.
name: Masonic Temple

excerpt: Opened in 1913, then abandoned for years, this former train station now has office & retail space.
detail_description: Michigan Central, a historic train station that first opened its doors in 1913, has undergone a remarkable transformation from abandonment to revitalization. Nestled in the heart of Corktown, this architectural gem stands as a testament to Detroit's rich history and resilience. Recently, significant investments have been made to establish the Michigan Central Innovation District around it. This initiative aims to create a vibrant hub for innovation and entrepreneurship while fostering community engagement and sustainable development.
name: Michigan Central

excerpt: Century-old ceramic studio offers one-of-a-kind pieces & classes alongside historical exhibits.
detail_description: Pewabic Pottery is an arts organization founded in 1903 that features craftsmanship in ceramic art. The organization has production studios where you can see pieces being created as well as changing exhibitions with educational programming.
name: Pewabic Pottery
address: 10125 E Jefferson Ave, Detroit, MI 48214, USA

detail_description: Belle Isle is a serene island getaway located within the city limits of Detroit, offering a peaceful escape from urban life. The Blue Heron Lagoon Trail provides a tranquil hiking experience with gravel paths and scenic views. Visitors can enjoy various attractions such as a beach, fountain, sports fields, aquarium, and conservatory. The park also features historical architecture from the 1800s and offers stunning vistas of both the Windsor and Detroit skylines.
name: Belle Isle
address: Belle Isle Park, 2 Woodside Dr, Detroit, MI 48207, USA

excerpt: Sprawling 14-acre plaza is home to the iconic Dodge Fountain, Jazz Fest & other major events.
detail_description: Hart Plaza is a sprawling 14-acre plaza located in downtown Detroit, right next to the Detroit RiverWalk. It features the iconic Dodge Fountain and hosts major events such as Jazz Fest and Movement Electronic Music Festival. The plaza is adorned with sculptures and offers benches for relaxation, impromptu concerts by talented buskers, and a picturesque view of downtown Windsor across the river.
name: Hart Plaza

detail_description: The Detroit Main Library, part of the Detroit Public Library system, is a stunning architectural gem with a rich history dating back to 1865. Originally housed in an old school building, it has since moved to its current location and now boasts 23 neighborhood branches. The library's main branch opened in 1921 and features an impressive collection of literature and reference materials. Even if you're not a bookworm, the beautiful building alone is worth a visit.
name: Detroit Main Library

detail_description: The Belt is a vibrant and revitalized district in Detroit, known for its artistic and cultural scene. This area was previously a neglected alley but has been transformed into a thriving hotspot. Situated in the former garment district between Broadway and Liberty Street, The Belt is an impressive project initiated by the Detroit-based art gallery Library Street Collective.
name: The Belt

detail_description: Little Caesars Arena, located in midtown Detroit, is a thrilling live sports arena that opened in 2017. It is home to the Detroit Red Wings hockey team and also hosts a variety of events including concerts by renowned artists like Beyonce and Elton John. The unique deconstructed layout features retail outlets, restaurants, and a box office outside the arena connected by a glass roof serving as an all-weather concourse.
name: Little Caesars Arena

excerpt: 19th-century military fort on the Detroit River with tours, re-enactments & community events.
detail_description: Historic Fort Wayne, located in the Delray neighborhood on the Detroit River, offers a captivating glimpse into Detroit's military history. The 19th-century fort has been meticulously restored and now serves as a museum and educational center, showcasing America's defense from the Revolutionary War to modern times. Visitors can explore original buildings such as the 1848 limestone barracks and the 1845 star fort, along with artifacts like cannons and uniforms.
name: Historic Fort Wayne
address: 6325 W Jefferson Ave, Detroit, MI 48209, USA

excerpt: Corktown is a trendy, youthful area with industrial-chic bars, intimate live-music venues, and hip breweries. Slows Bar BQ is a favored food joint, but there are also relaxed spots to eat Mexican and Japanese cuisine. Thrift stores, quirky boutiques, and secondhand record stores line the streets. The vast, derelict Beaux Arts building housing the Michigan Central Train Depot is earmarked for development.
detail_description: Corktown, located southwest of downtown, is a vibrant and youthful neighborhood known for its industrial-chic bars, live-music venues, and trendy breweries. The area offers a variety of dining options including popular food joints like Slows Bar BQ as well as relaxed spots serving Mexican and Japanese cuisine. Visitors can explore thrift stores, unique boutiques, and secondhand record stores along the streets. Notably, the Michigan Central Train Depot is set for development in this area.
name: Corktown

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of downtown Detroit, Beacon Park is a delightful green oasis that opened its doors to the public in May 2018. This triangular park, surrounded by towering skyscrapers, offers a refreshing escape from urban life. With its expansive lawn and vibrant atmosphere, it’s an ideal spot for everything from peaceful picnics to lively community events featuring food trucks and live music.
name: Beacon Park
address: 1901 Grand River Ave, Detroit, MI 48226, USA

detail_description: The Detroit Princess Riverboat offers a memorable cruise experience along the Detroit River, showcasing breathtaking views of the city skyline, especially at night. Guests can opt for a relaxing lunch cruise or an enchanting sunset dinner cruise, both providing a family-friendly environment. Additionally, the riverboat hosts an entertaining Motown cruise that pays homage to Detroit's musical legacy with all the classic hits.
name: Detroit Princess Riverboat

excerpt: Sprawling open-air history museum founded by Henry Ford with artifacts & homes of famous Americans.
detail_description: Greenfield Village is a vast outdoor museum established by Henry Ford, showcasing artifacts and residences of notable Americans. It is often referred to as "America's 1st Theme Park," offering an immersive experience in a carefully recreated late 1800s American village. The village features activities such as riding steam locomotive-pulled trains, hand-carved carousels, and viewing historical mechanical animatronics.
name: Greenfield Village

detail_description: The PEOPLE MOVER Fort Class Station is a convenient and affordable way to explore the revitalized downtown area of Detroit. The 3-mile loop with 13 stops offers a quick tour, allowing you to admire original artworks at the stations funded by the Downtown Detroit People Mover Art Commission. This elevated metro line is also kid-friendly, offering free rides for children under five, making it an excellent option for sightseeing with little ones.
name: PEOPLE MOVER Fort Class Station

excerpt: Lions home stadium offering behind-the-scenes NFL tours & an attached 1920s-era warehouse.
detail_description: Ford Field, located in downtown Detroit, is the home stadium of the NFL's Detroit Lions. It offers behind-the-scenes tours and hosts various events throughout the year, making it a popular destination for sports enthusiasts. The stadium's multifunctionality allows for concerts, monster truck shows, and other events in addition to football games. Situated in historic Corktown, it is within walking distance to Comerica Park and Little Caesars Arena.
name: Ford Field

excerpt: Mexicantown-Southwest Detroit is a down-to-earth neighborhood filled with informal restaurants offering traditional Mexican food, from tamales to tacos. Laid-back bars and tiki lounges serve margaritas; grocery stores brim with corn and plantains; and old-school bakeries sell sugary churros. Family-oriented Clark Park is a popular spot for baseball, while cultural center El Museo del Norte showcases Latino art.
detail_description: Mexicantown, located in southwest Detroit near the Ambassador Bridge to Canada, is a lively neighborhood known for its authentic Mexican cuisine and tight-knit community spirit. The area is filled with informal restaurants offering traditional Mexican food like tamales and tacos, as well as laid-back bars serving margaritas. Grocery stores are stocked with fresh produce like corn and plantains, while old-school bakeries sell sugary churros.
name: Mexicantown

detail_description: If you're a book lover, John K. King Used & Rare Books in Detroit is a must-visit destination. Housed in a former glove factory, this bookstore spans four floors and holds over a million books, making it an ideal spot for literary exploration. Upon arrival, you'll receive a map to guide you through the various sections, but feel free to wander off the beaten path and embark on your own spontaneous adventure among the shelves.
name: John K. King Used & Rare Books
address: 901 W Lafayette Blvd, Detroit, MI 48226, USA

detail_description: Located in downtown Detroit, the Rosa Parks Transit Center is a central station named after the renowned civil rights activist. The center offers access to various bus routes, making it convenient for travelers to reach their destinations. Visitors have praised the cleanliness of the facilities, particularly noting the well-maintained restrooms. Additionally, there is a sense of security at the transit center as transit police and Detroit Police Department are always nearby to address any emergencies or issues that may arise.
name: Rosa Parks Transit Center

excerpt: GM’s riverfront headquarters house shops, eateries & a 73-story hotel, plus a concept car showroom.
detail_description: The GM Renaissance Center, also known as RenCen, is an iconic riverfront complex in Detroit that serves as the global headquarters for General Motors. Designed by architect John Portman, this architectural marvel consists of interconnected blue glass cylinder buildings and stands as the tallest in the city. Visitors can explore a variety of offerings within its premises, including shops, eateries, a 73-story hotel, and a concept car showroom that spans 44,000 square feet.
name: General Motors Renaissance Center

excerpt: Colorful cultural museum with a sculpture garden & painted wall displaying handmade beads & crafts.
detail_description: The Dabls Mbad African Bead Museum in Detroit is a vibrant cultural museum that showcases the city's diverse heritage through an extensive collection of African art, beadwork, jewelry, installations, and sculptures. The museum features a colorful sculpture garden and painted walls adorned with handmade beads and crafts. Thousands of bead strands from various African countries and materials are on display throughout the gallery.
name: Dabls Mbad African Bead Museum

excerpt: Legendary hot dog diner offering a no-frills menu of chili-topped dogs, burgers & fries.
detail_description: Lafayette Coney Island is a renowned hot dog diner in Detroit, known for its no-frills menu featuring chili-topped dogs, burgers, and fries. It has been serving customers since 1924 and is part of the list of legendary eateries still operating today in the area.
name: Lafayette Coney Island
address: 118 W Lafayette Blvd, Detroit, MI 48226, USA

excerpt: Grand, restored circa-1904 public aquarium known for its extensive collection of gar fish.
detail_description: Belle Isle Aquarium, a grand public aquarium dating back to 1904, is a beloved landmark within Belle Isle Park. Designed by architect Albert Kahn, it boasts a stunning collection of gar fish and other fascinating sea creatures like African Lungfish, Electric Eels, and Mbu Pufferfish. After temporarily closing in 2005 due to financial constraints, the aquarium reopened in 2012 under the management of volunteers from the Belle Isle Conservancy.
name: Belle Isle Aquarium

excerpt: Modern museum showcases Arab-American history & cultural exhibits amid a central atrium & courtyard.
detail_description: Nestled in Dearborn, the Arab American National Museum stands as a vibrant testament to the rich tapestry of Arab American history and culture. This unique institution is not just a museum; it’s an immersive experience that invites visitors to explore historical documents, captivating artifacts, and engaging art displays. The central atrium and courtyard create a welcoming atmosphere for community gatherings and cultural events.
name: Arab American National Museum

excerpt: Iconic lumber baron's mansion with exquisite garden serving upscale New American cuisine.
detail_description: Located near the Museum of Contemporary Art in Midtown, The Whitney is a historic mansion built by lumber baron David Whitney Jr. in 1894. This iconic eatery offers an upscale New American cuisine experience within its exquisite garden setting. Celebrated for its romantic dining atmosphere, The Whitney recently featured a special four-course Valentine's Day dinner menu accompanied by live music.
name: The Whitney

excerpt: Woodwork-filled brew pub with a massive beer list offering creative pub fare & brunch items.
detail_description: HopCat is a woodwork-filled brew pub located in Detroit, which opened its doors in 2014. It boasts Michigan's largest tap selection with 130 craft beer taps and offers delicious food made from scratch. The second floor features the Huma Room, an entertainment venue available for special events. The menu includes creative pub fare and brunch items, with options for vegans and vegetarians.
name: HopCat

excerpt: 982-acre island featuring trails, an aquarium, museum, conservatory, disc golf course & playground.
detail_description: Belle Isle Park, a 982-acre island located just 4 miles east of downtown Detroit, is a scenic destination offering a variety of attractions and activities. Originally designed by Frederick Law Olmsted in 1879, the park features the Belle Isle Aquarium, Anna Scripps Whitcomb Conservatory, Dossin Great Lakes Museum, and James Scott Memorial Fountain. Visitors can also enjoy outdoor activities such as hiking, biking, fishing, and birdwatching.
name: Belle Isle Park

excerpt: Guests can explore this prominent family's estate including 1930s-era architecture & landscaping.
detail_description: Ford House, located in Grosse Pointe Shores just outside Detroit, is a historic mansion with a fairy-tale vibe. The estate features 1930s-era architecture and landscaping designed by renowned architect Albert Kahn to resemble the Cotswold cottages of England. The sandstone exterior and slate roof set against breathtaking gardens make it an impossibly romantic photo location. This hidden gem overlooks Lake St.
name: Ford House
address: 1100 Lake Shore Rd, Grosse Pointe Shores, MI 48236, USA
